text: TÃ¼rkiye will continue to strengthen and maintain its status as a safe haven for international investments and investors.                                                                                                                                                                  We have made TÃ¼rkiye a key country for crisis resolution thanks to our balanced, principled, and reasonable policies.  Throughout every crisis, we have steadfastly advocated for justice, peace, human rights and freedoms.  We have been among the first to engage with the affected parties in all crises, from the war between Russia and Ukraine to the instability in Syria, to the human tragedy in Gaza.  To date, our most significant accomplishment has been averting the involvement of our country in violent conflicts and preventing the spread of instability within our borders.  We have deployed all available resources at our disposal in order to put an end to the bloodshed, wherever it may be.  We never consider the faith or origin of the oppressed while protecting them, as we are fully aware that it is our responsibility to stand firm against the oppressor.  Inshallah, we will continue the same honourable stance from now on.  While taking these steps in foreign policy, we have never put the economy on the back burner.  Without compromising our strategy of fostering national growth through investment, employment, production, exports, and current account surplus, we have formulated, executed, and will continue to execute policies that deliver on current requirements.  To attract foreign direct investments to our country, we will streamline legal procedures pertaining to commerce, financing, and investment.  We will make arrangements in the basic tax laws to establish an investor-friendly, straightforward, easy-to-understand, and fair tax system.  While continuing to shape the Century of TÃ¼rkiye vision leading up to 2053, we will diligently strive to repay the nation for its unwavering support by working tirelessly throughout the day and night.

text: I hope that the terminal building and runway of Ercan Airport, which we have inaugurated today, will be auspicious for the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.                                                                                                                           In addition to its direct contribution to tourism, a more modern and spacious terminal building will generate more investment, revenue, and employment.  Ercan Airport currently has the highest passenger capacity of all airports on the island of Cyprus.  This initiative will help establish the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus as a recognized brand in the Eastern Mediterranean, which represents a bastion of stability in the Eastern Mediterranean.  Ercan Airport currently offers direct flights to only TÃ¼rkiye due to the unfair and unlawful practices of the international community.  Ercan Airport provides air traffic services in accordance with International Civil Aviation standards.  The airport serves both domestic and international passengers with advanced technology and Turkish hospitality.  It will not be long before the new terminal and runway, which we have inaugurated today, are used for international flights.  I invite the international community to heed the call of the former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, who acknowledged that there is no UN Security Council Resolution to justify the isolation of our Turkish Cypriot brothers and sisters, and to lift these purely political restrictions with no legal basis.  I reiterate my call for support of the ideal of two equal states coexisting on the island of Cyprus, as opposed to dominance, tension, and a culture of conflict.
